# The `PassBuilderPipelines.cpp` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This file provides the implementation of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passbuilder">PassBuilder</a> based on our static pass registry as well as related functionality. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This file provides the implementation of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passbuilder">PassBuilder</a> based on our static pass registry as well as related functionality.

It also provides helpers to aid in analyzing, debugging, and testing passes and pass pipelines.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Form canonically associated expression trees, and simplify the trees using</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// basic mathematical properties. For example, this will form (nearly)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Add the primary loop simplification pipeline.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: Currently this is split into two loop pass pipelines because we run</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// some function passes in between them. These can and should be removed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and/or replaced by scheduling the loop pass equivalents in the correct</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// positions. But those equivalent passes aren&#39;t powerful enough yet.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Specifically, &#96;SimplifyCFGPass&#96; and &#96;InstCombinePass&#96; are currently still</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// used. We have &#96;LoopSimplifyCFGPass&#96; which isn&#39;t yet powerful enough yet to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// fully replace &#96;SimplifyCFGPass&#96;, and the closest to the other we have is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#96;LoopInstSimplify&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a613892f4c1a570fd3747f2b6b1bf9b75">LoopPassManager</a> LPM1, LPM2;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Simplify the loop body. We do this initially to clean up after other loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// passes run, either when iterating on a loop or on inner loops with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// implications on the outer loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><Highlight kind="normal">  LPM1.addPass(LoopInstSimplifyPass());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><Highlight kind="normal">  LPM1.addPass(LoopSimplifyCFGPass());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Try to remove as much code from the loop header as possible,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to reduce amount of IR that will have to be duplicated. However,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// do not perform speculative hoisting the first time as LICM</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// will destroy metadata that may not need to be destroyed if run</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// after loop rotation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Investigate promotion cap for O1.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"><Highlight kind="normal">  LPM1.addPass(LICMPass(PTO.LicmMssaOptCap, PTO.LicmMssaNoAccForPromotionCap,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><Highlight kind="normal">                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;AllowSpeculation=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">));</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1758"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These passes import type identifier resolutions for whole-program</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1759"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// devirtualization and CFI. They must run early because other passes may</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1760"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// disturb the specific instruction patterns that these passes look for,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1761"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// creating dependencies on resolutions that may not appear in the summary.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1762"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1763"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For example, GVN may transform the pattern assume(type.test) appearing in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1764"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// two basic blocks into assume(phi(type.test, type.test)), which would</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1767"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1768"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Also, WPD has access to more precise information than ICP and can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1769"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// devirtualize more effectively, so it should operate on the IR first.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1770"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
